member.name: T:vrc.Session
member.summary: The Session represents a connection with the client

member.name: M:vrc.Session.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Constructor - create a new session for a client's connection

member.name: M:vrc.Session.delegateCmd(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the incoming string and get the command together with uid delegate the command to the LDC-Client by adding the command into the LDC-Client's command queue
member.param: the string sent by the client

member.name: M:vrc.Session.RepeatedLoginErr(vrc.VRCPCmd,System.Guid)
member.summary: Construct the error reply message when an old client is already logged in

member.name: M:vrc.Session.findExistingClient(vrc.CommandObject)
member.summary: Used to find the LDCClient instance in the Object Pool which has already done the the login(same login parameters as cmdObj )
member.returns: the LDCClient instance if found one; otherwise, null

member.name: M:vrc.Session.InvalidUid(vrc.VRCPCmd)
member.summary: This method returns a special failure message when the uid from client does not exist in the object pool.

member.name: M:vrc.Session.parseCmd(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the request string from client (read from socket) according to VRCP protocal extract the relavate information (command, uid, etc) and combine them into the command object
member.param: the request string sent from Client
member.returns: null: wrong syntax in the request, command parsing failed CommandObject: command together with its parameters (The Cmd member is set to VRCPCmd.Unknown if the command is unknown)

member.name: M:vrc.Session.getCmd(System.String)
member.summary: Find out the VRCP command in request string by enumerating all the commands in VRCPCmd

member.name: M:vrc.Session.getUid(System.String)
member.summary: Help method to extract Unique ID from request string
member.returns: Unique ID Guid.Empty when fail to extract unique ID

member.name: M:vrc.Session.Dispose
member.summary: This method is called when session ends (client disconnected): 1) The socket with client will be closed 2) The data member "currentSession" of the bounded LDCClient is reset to null (so that the PoolOptimizer is allowed to remove the LDCClient) 3) The Monitoring class will be notified to count down the number of connected clients

member.param: if errorMsg exists (not null, Length > 0 ), write the errorMsg into log

member.name: M:vrc.LDCClient.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Close Connection with LDC-Server (Count down connection number when necessary)

member.name: M:vrc.LDCClient.processLogin(vrc.CommandObject,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This is a wrapper method which deals with Login only The purpose is to keep a flag to notify whether login succeeds. The connection to the Client will be closed when the fLoginSuccess is set to false

member.name: M:vrc.LDCClient.isBounded
member.summary: determine whether the LDCClient is bound to a client

member.name: M:vrc.LDCClient.setCurrentSession(vrc.Session)
member.summary: Add the reference to the bounded session object It helps the Pool Optimizer to select idle LDCClient Only LDCClient with no bounded session(session == null) can be selected

member.name: P:vrc.LDCClient.TrafficId
member.summary: the actual traffic id in the transaction saver

member.name: P:vrc.LDCClient.LastTrafficTime
member.summary: the time when the last indication message of the current traffic arrives

member.name: P:vrc.LDCClient.RecordingAvailable
member.summary: indication of the bRecordingAvailable flag in the transaction saver
